head.supplied: ¶ We the undersigned members of the Medical Society request you will be good enough to call a special meeting of the Members at an early date, to memorialize the Council of the University of Melbourn...

div.p: Minute book, Medical Society of Victoria, Australian Medical Association, Melbourne.

Letter not found; text is from the minutes of the meeting of the Medical Society of Victoria held on 2 December 1863.
We the undersigned members of the Medical Society request you will be good enough to call a special meeting of the Members at an early date, to memorialize the Council of the University of Melbourne so to alter the time over which the studies required by the Medical Curriculum extend as to make it equal with that prescribed by the best schools of Grt Britain.
Blainey (1957), p. 30: 'A deputation from the Medical Society of Victoria protested that the course was too long and that time was wasted in imparting a liberal education in the arts.' The medical course in Melbourne was five years compared with four years in Scotland and England.

cell.p:
J. Black
J or T? Either Thomas or Joseph Black, both of whom were members of the Society.
